snippet: China’s incredible economic growth spurt shows signs of slowing, as April imports fell to near zero and exports were half of what was expected for the month.
abstract: China's economic growth is showing increasing signs that it may be slowing; growth in imports unexpectedly came to a halt in April, rising just 0.3 percent from the same period a year earlier; exports grew 4.9 percent for the month, half as much as economists had predicted; growth in other sectors also appears to be slowing.
lead_paragraph: China’s incredible economic growth spurt shows signs of slowing, as April imports fell to near zero and exports were half of what was expected for the month.

headline.main: Data Signals Economic Trouble in China
headline.print_headline: Chinese Economy Losing Some Of Its Sizzle
